required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of HSK3486 Injectable Emulsion in Subjects Undergoing Fiberoptic Bronchoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Propofol-Controlled Phase III Clinical Trial Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of HSK3486 Injectable Emulsion for the Induction of Sedation/Anesthesia in Subjects Undergoing Fiberoptic Bronchoscopy

lead_sponsor.agency: Sichuan Haisco Pharmaceutical Group Co., Ltd

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Propofol-Controlled Phase III Clinical Trial. Around 260 eligible subjects are planned to be enrolled and randomized in a 1:1 ratio to either the HSK3486 arm or propofol arm. The main objective is to evaluate the efficacy of HSK3486 vs. propofol for the induction of sedation/anesthesia in subjects undergoing fiberoptic bronchoscopy.

primary_outcome.measure: Success rate of fiberoptic bronchoscopy. A successful diagnosis/treatment should meet both of the following:
primary_outcome.time_frame: During induction of sedation/anesthetic on day 1
primary_outcome.description: Completion of fiberoptic bronchoscopy; No alternative sedation/anesthetic drugs are used, that is, the number of doses of the study drug is ≤ 5 times within any given 15-minute period, starting from the initial administration until the fiberoptic bronchoscopy is completed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial administration of the investigational drug to the first time when MOAA/S is ≤1 on day 1
From the last dose of study drug or rescue sedative AND from end of fiberoptic bronchoscopy until the patient has recovered to fully alert on day 1
secondary_outcome.description: the time from the withdrawal of the bronchoscope or the last dose of the study drug to the first of 3 consecutive MOAA/S scores = 5

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from the last dose of study drug or rescue sedative and from the end of fiberoptic bronchoscopy until discharge (defined as the ability to walk unassisted) on day 1
secondary_outcome.description: the time from the withdrawal of the bronchoscope or the last dose of the study drug to the first of 3 consecutive Aldrete scores ≥ 9

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of the investigational drug and alternative drugs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During induction of sedation/anesthetic on day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of questionnaires to estimate sedation/anesthesia satisfaction, including satisfaction assessments of the subject and anesthesiologist
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During induction of sedation/anesthetic on day 1

arm_group.description: Subjects < 65 years old:0.4mg/kg/0.15mg/kg;Subjects ≥ 65 years old:75% of the dose for subjects < 65 years old.
Subjects < 65 years old:2mg/kg/0.75mg/kg;Subjects≥ 65 years old:75% of the dose for subjects < 65 years old.

intervention.description: Subjects < 65 years old:Initial dose of 0.4 mg/kg followed by 0.15 mg/kg if needed;Subjects ≥ 65 years old:75% of the dose for subjects < 65 years old.
Subjects < 65 years old:Initial dose of 2 mg/kg followed by 0.75 mg/kg if needed;Subjects ≥ 65 years old:75% of the dose for subjects < 65 years old.
